intro: Cycnoches barbatum, commonly known as the hairy cycnoches, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often display a mix of colors including white, yellow, and green. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom during the wet season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
